metadata.description: The regional network spoke VNet Resource ID that the cluster will be joined to
Azure AD Group in the identified tenant that will be granted the highly prividledged cluster-admin role.
Your AKS control plane Cluster API authentication tenant
The certificate data for app gateway TLS termination. It is base64
The base 64 encoded AKS Ingress Controller public certificate (as .crt or .cer) to be stored in Azure Key Vault as secret and referenced by Azure Application Gateway as a trusted root certificate.
AKS Service, Node Pools, and supporting services (KeyVault, App Gateway, etc) region. This needs to be the same region as the vnet provided in these parameters.

For Azure resources that support native geo-redunancy, provide the location the redundant service will have its secondary. Should be different than the location parameter and ideally should be a paired region - https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/best-practices-availability-paired-regions. This region does not need to support availability zones.

resources.name: [variables('clusterControlPlaneIdentityName')]
resources.comments: The control plane identity used by the cluster. Used for networking access (VNET joining and DNS updating)

resources.name: mi-appgateway-frontend
resources.comments: User Managed Identity that App Gateway is assigned. Used for Azure Key Vault Access.

resources.name: vmss-jumpboxes
resources.comments: Hosts the VMs used as AKS jumpboxes. Using VMSS as a way to manage spanning fault and update domains.

resources.name: podmi-ingress-controller
resources.comments: User Managed Identity for the cluster's ingress controller pods. Used for Azure Key Vault Access.

resources.name: [concat('Microsoft.Authorization/', guid(resourceGroup().id, variables('managedIdentityOperatorRole')))]
resources.comments: Grant the AKS cluster with Managed Identity Operator role permissions on this pod identity, so that it can be assigned to nodes as needed. TODO: RACE CONDITION -- checks for this before creating pod managed identity.  Move to User Managed identity for the cluster!

resources.name: [concat('Microsoft.Authorization/', guid(resourceGroup().id, variables('readerRole')))]
resources.comments: Grant the AKS cluster ingress controller with reader role permissions over KeyVault

resources.name: [guid(parameters('targetVnetResourceId'), variables('dnsZoneContributorRole'), variables('clusterControlPlaneIdentityName'))]
resources.comments: Allows AKS Cluster Identity to /read and /join/action on the virtual network (required with bring your own private dns.)

properties.description: Allows cluster identity to join the attach custom DNS zone with Private Link information to this virtual network.
Allows cluster identity to join the nodepool to this subnet.
Allows cluster identity to join the nodepool to this subnet.
Allows cluster identity to join the nodepool to this subnet.
Allows cluster identity to join ingress resources to this subnet.
Allows cluster identity to manage zone Entries for cluster's Private Link configuration.

resources.name: [guid(resourceGroup().id, variables('clusterName'))]
resources.comments: It is required to grant the AKS cluster with Virtual Machine Contributor role permissions over the cluster infrastructure resource group to work with Managed Identities and aad-pod-identity. Otherwise MIC component fails while attempting to update MSI on VMSS cluster nodes

properties.displayName: Increase number of forbidden response on the Ingress Controller
properties.query: let value = toscalar(InsightsMetrics | where Namespace == "prometheus" and Name == "traefik_entrypoint_requests_total" | where parse_json(Tags).code == 403 | summarize Value = avg(Val) by bin(TimeGenerated, 5m) | summarize min = min(Value)); InsightsMetrics | where Namespace == "prometheus" and Name == "traefik_entrypoint_requests_total" | where parse_json(Tags).code == 403 | summarize AggregatedValue = avg(Val)-value by bin(TimeGenerated, 5m) | order by TimeGenerated | render barchart
InsightsMetrics | where Namespace == "prometheus" and Name == "kured_reboot_required" | where Val > 0

properties.description: Alert on pod Failed phase.

source.query:
[concat('//https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/insights/container-insights-alerts 
 let endDateTime = now(); let startDateTime = ago(1h); let trendBinSize = 1m; let clusterName = "',variables('clusterName'),'"; KubePodInventory | where TimeGenerated < endDateTime | where TimeGenerated >= startDateTime | where ClusterName == clusterName | distinct ClusterName, TimeGenerated | summarize ClusterSnapshotCount = count() by bin(TimeGenerated, trendBinSize), ClusterName | join hint.strategy=broadcast ( KubePodInventory | where TimeGenerated < endDateTime | where TimeGenerated >= startDateTime | distinct ClusterName, Computer, PodUid, TimeGenerated, PodStatus | summarize TotalCount = count(), PendingCount = sumif(1, PodStatus =~ "Pending"), RunningCount = sumif(1, PodStatus =~ "Running"), SucceededCount = sumif(1, PodStatus =~ "Succeeded"), FailedCount = sumif(1, PodStatus =~ "Failed") by ClusterName, bin(TimeGenerated, trendBinSize) ) on ClusterName, TimeGenerated | extend UnknownCount = TotalCount - PendingCount - RunningCount - SucceededCount - FailedCount | project TimeGenerated, TotalCount = todouble(TotalCount) / ClusterSnapshotCount, PendingCount = todouble(PendingCount) / ClusterSnapshotCount, RunningCount = todouble(RunningCount) / ClusterSnapshotCount, SucceededCount = todouble(SucceededCount) / ClusterSnapshotCount, FailedCount = todouble(FailedCount) / ClusterSnapshotCount, UnknownCount = todouble(UnknownCount) / ClusterSnapshotCount| summarize AggregatedValue = avg(FailedCount) by bin(TimeGenerated, trendBinSize)')]

properties.description: All azure advisor alerts

resources.name: [concat('Microsoft.Authorization/', guid(resourceId('Microsoft.ContainerService/managedClusters', variables('clusterName')), 'omsagent', variables('monitoringMetricsPublisherRole')))]
resources.comments: Grant the OMS Agent's Managed Identity the metrics publisher role to push alerts

resources.name: [concat('Node CPU utilization high for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-1')]

properties.description: Node CPU utilization across the cluster.

resources.name: [concat('Node working set memory utilization high for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-2')]

properties.description: Node working set memory utilization across the cluster.

resources.name: [concat('Jobs completed more than 6 hours ago for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-11')]

properties.description: This alert monitors completed jobs (more than 6 hours ago).

resources.name: [concat('Container CPU usage high for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-9')]

properties.description: This alert monitors container CPU utilization.

resources.name: [concat('Container working set memory usage high for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-10')]

properties.description: This alert monitors container working set memory utilization.

resources.name: [concat('Pods in failed state for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-4')]

properties.description: Pod status monitoring.
This alert monitors disk usage for all nodes and storage devices.

resources.name: [concat('Nodes in not ready status for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-3')]

properties.description: Node status monitoring.

resources.name: [concat('Containers getting OOM killed for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-6')]

properties.description: This alert monitors number of containers killed due to out of memory (OOM) error.

resources.name: [concat('Persistent volume usage high for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-18')]

properties.description: This alert monitors persistent volume utilization.

resources.name: [concat('Pods not in ready state for ', variables('clusterName'), ' CI-8')]

properties.description: This alert monitors for excessive pods not in the ready state.
This alert monitors number of containers restarting across the cluster.
